Key Match Events: Brazil missed a string of chances and were held 0-0 by Costa Rica in their Copa América Group D opener.
Raphinha had an excellent early opportunity to score but Costa Rica keeper Patrick Sequeira came quickly off his line to snuff out the danger.

Brazil thought they had got the breakthrough in the 30th minute when a free kick was flicked on by Rodrygo into the path of Marquinhos, who poked it in at the far post but the goal was disallowed for offside after a lengthy VAR delay.
Lucas Paquetá rattled the woodwork with a long-range effort in the 63rd minute.
A venomous Guilherme Arana strike was kept out by a fine save from Sequeira.
Coach Dorival Júnior brought on youngsters Endrick and Sávio in the 70th minute as Brazil desperately sought a winner but Paquetá twice shot wide in the final 10 minutes.
Post-Match Reflections: Vinícius Junior said after the game, 'We know we can improve, we have to improve. I also know what I can improve, evolve and do for our team.'
Dorival Júnior said post-game, 'We tried with [Vinícius] on the wing and we didn’t succeed. Then we put him inside and we couldn’t find a way through either ... he was very well marked.'
Vinícius said, 'Every time I enter the field for the national team, I have three or four players marking me.'

Vinícius said, 'New coach, new players, everything takes time. Our fans want everything immediately done, but we’re going little by little. In the next game, I’m sure we’ll play much better because we now already understand what the competition will be like, what the pitch, what the referees will be like.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brazil’s all-time leading scorer Neymar, who has been sidelined by an anterior cruciate ligament injury, cut a dejected figure as he looked on from the stands.

Frustration has become the norm for Brazil in recent years. After 18 months of upheaval in the federation, dugout and squad, they have fallen to sixth in South American qualifying for the 2026 World Cup.
This summer’s Copa América was billed as a chance to hit a reset with a new manager and fresh, young stars. After a flat opening draw, Vinícius is still preaching patience.
